title: Dominican Republic: Citi Successfully Concludes Its 2017 "Women's Entrepreneurs" Program
summary: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic - Citi Dominican Republic, in collaboration with Banco de Ahorro y Crédito ADOPEM and Junior Achievement Dominicana, concluded a new edition of "Women Entrepreneurs," a program that features a series of activities designed to further women's entrepreneurial development.
tag-1: Dominican Republic: Citi Successfully Concludes Its 2017 "Women's Entrepreneurs" Program
tag-3: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic – Citi Dominican Republic, in collaboration with Banco de Ahorro y Crédito ADOPEM and Junior Achievement Dominicana, concluded a new edition of "Women Entrepreneurs," a program that features a series of activities designed to further women's entrepreneurial development.
tag-4: To date, the program has benefited more than 6,000 women. This year, it emphasized the financial and micro-finance capacity women need for professional development and economic independence, as well as improving their emotional intelligence and self-esteem.
tag-5: Máximo Vidal, Citi Country Officer (CCO) for the Dominican Republic, presided over the program's closing ceremony, with Mercedes Canalda, Executive President of ADOPEM; Claribel Díaz, Director of ADOPEM NGO; and César Asiático, Executive Director of Junior Achievement Dominicana.
tag-6: Vidal addressed some motivational words to the program's participants, expressing support for their business projects. "The purpose of this program is to help Dominican women become true agents of socioeconomic change within their families and communities," he stated. "The businesses they start will serve as models for creating wealth and jobs and contribute to the nation's overall development."
tag-7: For her part, Canalda interacted with the program participants, inviting them to share their impressions. She expressed admiration for the impressive talent and effort demonstrated by Dominican women, and their individual achievements in managing their households and businesses.
tag-8: "The most important aspect of the 'Women Entrepreneurs' program is its impact in terms of change, empowerment and leadership," Canalda remarked. "In the future, we hope to extend its reach further to the northeastern part of the country, including the province of Montecristi."
tag-9: "Women Entrepreneurs" is designed to modify the economic behavior of thousands of women around the country, helping them realize their potential capacity to solve problems, make decisions and manage their finances at work and at home, as well as promote good savings and investment habits. The program is part of Citi's commitment to close the gender gap and create new economic opportunities for women. It is implemented jointly with Junior Achievement in a number of Central and South American countries.
tag-10: "Programs like this one help us understand women's needs and assign the financial resources and services they need to build a stable future for themselves and their families, while contributing to the country's economic growth," Citi's CCO said of the initiative.
